intro: Lomatia milnei, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lomatia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its woody shrub structure. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, with a distinctive, waxy texture. Lomatia milnei is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
